smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams contain content; no completely empty diagrams were found.
All use cases in the diagrams (Page 2 and Page 8) are associated with at least one actor.
No instances were found where two use cases describe the same activity for the same actor.
No duplicate model element names were found within the same package.
No redundant data columns without Foreign Key connections were detected in the transformed database diagrams.

Inconsistent naming conventions are used. The main diagrams use Estonian 'Verb Noun' format (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja' on Page 2), while Page 8 uses English 'Noun Noun' format ('Use Case1'). Additionally, Page 1 lists 'registreeri pakiautomaat' (lowercase) alongside 'Aktiveeri pakiautomaat' (uppercase).
All states in the State Diagram on Page 24 appear to be reachable.
All actions in the activity diagrams appear to be reachable via control flows.
Relationships in the class diagrams (e.g., Page 18) define multiplicity at both ends (e.g., 0..*, 1).
The Use Case diagram on Page 2 contains 11 use cases (visual oval elements), which exceeds the limit of 10 central elements.

On Page 18 (Kontseptuaalne eskiismudel), the class 'Töötaja' has 6 visual connection lines to other elements (Isik, Töötaja (mentor), Töötaja_rolli_omamine, Töötaja_seisundi_liik, and two connections to Pakiautomaat).
The diagram elements are distributed relatively evenly; no specific related elements are placed excessively far apart compared to the average distance.
The use case 'Use Case1' on Page 8 does not start with an active verb.
No classes, tables, or attributes were found with names of 3 characters or less (excluding standard abbreviations like ID/PK/FK logic).
All class and table names start with an uppercase letter and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Töötaja').

Several attributes start with an uppercase letter, violating the camelCase rule. Examples include 'E_mail', 'Eesnimi', 'Perenimi' (Page 20), 'Asukoht_Laiuskraad', 'Asukoht_Pikkuskraad', and 'Kirjeldus' (Page 18/23).
Database table names (in transformed diagrams) are singular (e.g., 'Tootaja', 'Pakiautomaat').
No Hungarian notation or type prefixes (like tbl_, str_) were found on names.
